page.syntax: Port_Assigned as N = Datagram_Handler(C Name,N tcp_port,C match,C code)

argument.name: Name
argument.description: The name to assign to the handler.

argument.name: match
argument.description: The data to watch for in the message stream.

page.description: Setup an named asynchronous handler - when input matches the 'match string' , the code will be invoked with the incoming string in a_message.
page.discussion: DATAGRAMS are a lightweight, asynchronous form of sockets communication that Windows supports. The .DATAGRAM_HANDLER() method sets up a named asynchronous handler. When the content in a message matches the Match string, the Code will be invoked.
page.example: dim p as N p = Sockets.datagram_handler("foo", 0, "*" + crlf(), <<%code% on error goto error a_result = ""+eval(a_message)+crlf()+"Ok" stop error: a_result = ""+crlf()+"Ok" %code%) ? p = 4557.000000
